column4: I'd rather just get xxms, have it be a much more compact player, and have it work right away
command not found or "no input files"?
oh, okay....
that's odd
it should be finding it if you installed it;
when I say "apt-get install kernel-source" it gives me three versions to pick from
none of them are my kernel version
what do I do?
do you need the source or the headers?
the source
so I can install Nvidia drivers
you only need the headers
the headers are already on there....
and the driver installation complains that it can't find kernel source.
do you have a sym link at /usr/src/linux -> /usr/src/<header dir>?
and you don know that the nvidia modules are in the linux-restricted-modules package right?
so there is little need to build them
the only thing in my /usr/src/ directory is an "rpm" directory.
then you don't have the headers installed
